questions.question: What is the First Law of Thermodynamics?
options: Energy can be created and destroyed
Entropy of a closed system can never decrease
Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred or changed in form
Energy can be transferred by conduction, convection, or radiation
questions.correct_answer: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred or changed in form

questions.question: What is the main concept behind the Second Law of Thermodynamics?
options: Energy is constant and can neither be created nor destroyed
The entropy of an isolated system not in equilibrium will tend to increase over time
Heat can flow from a cold body to a hot body only with the help of an external work
Heat energy cannot be completely converted into mechanical work
questions.correct_answer: The entropy of an isolated system not in equilibrium will tend to increase over time

questions.question: What is entropy?
options: The energy of a system that is available for doing mechanical work
The transfer of energy as heat to or from a system
The measure of disorder or randomness in a system
The force that opposes motion between two surfaces that are in contact
questions.correct_answer: The measure of disorder or randomness in a system

questions.question: In thermodynamics, what is a 'closed system'?
options: A system where energy and matter can be exchanged with the surroundings
A system where no energy or matter can be exchanged with the surroundings
A system where only energy, but not matter, can be exchanged with the surroundings
A system where only matter, but not energy, can be exchanged with the surroundings
questions.correct_answer: A system where only energy, but not matter, can be exchanged with the surroundings

questions.question: What does a thermodynamic process involve?
options: Change in the state of a thermodynamic system
Static state of a thermodynamic system
No change in the internal energy of a system
Non-exchange of heat between a system and its surroundings
questions.correct_answer: Change in the state of a thermodynamic system

questions.question: What is the unit of temperature in the International System of Units (SI)?
options: Fahrenheit
Kelvin
Celsius
Rankine

questions.question: What term is used to describe the amount of heat energy required to raise the temperature of a substance?
options: Entropy
Enthalpy
Specific Heat Capacity
Thermal Conductivity

questions.question: What does the zeroth law of thermodynamics establish?
options: The concept of temperature
The concept of energy conservation
The concept of entropy
The concept of thermal equilibrium

questions.question: Which term refers to a thermodynamic quantity equivalent to the total heat content of a system?
options: Entropy
Enthalpy
Thermal Expansion
Internal Energy

questions.question: In a thermodynamic process, if the system does not exchange heat with its surroundings, it is referred to as what type of process?
options: Adiabatic
Isothermal
Isobaric
Isochoric
